name: Shazam
description: Identify any song. Discover, artists, lyrics, videos & playlists to create a song detector site/application such as shazam.com

api_methods.name: shazam-events/list
api_methods.description: List future events

parameters.name: artistId
parameters.description:
The value of 'artist->adamid' field returned in …/search OR …/songs/v2/detect OR …/songs/get-details endpoint
The value of 'artists->id' field returned in …/shazam-songs/get-details OR …/albums/get-details OR …/albums/get-related-artist

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: The language code

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The date to list events from

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items per page, for paging purpose

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The page index, for paging purpose

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The date to list events to. Ex : 2023-01-15

api_methods.name: songs/detect
api_methods.description:
You may check the tutorial at https://rapidapi.com/apidojo/api/shazam/tutorials.
Detect songs from raw sound data. The raw sound data must be 44100Hz, 1 channel (Mono), signed 16 bit PCM little endian. Other types of media are NOT supported, such as : mp3, wav, etc... or need to be converted to uncompressed raw data. If the result is empty, your request data must be in wrong format in most case. Encoded base64 string of byte[] that generated from raw data less than 500KB (3-5 seconds sample are good enough for detection) will be sent via body as plain text

utterances.utterance: Can you identify this song from the audio clip I recorded?
What’s the name of the song in this sound sample I just captured?

Can you tell me which song is in this short audio recording?

What song is this? I’ve got a 3-second audio clip for you to analyze.
Can you figure out the song from this mono audio sample?
I have a 5-second audio file. Can you detect the song in it?
What’s the title of the song in this uncompressed audio clip?
Can you recognize the song from this 44100Hz mono audio sample?

api_methods.name: songs/v2/detect
api_methods.description:
You may check the tutorial at https://rapidapi.com/apidojo/api/shazam/tutorials.
Detect songs from raw sound data. The raw sound data must be 44100Hz, 1 channel (Mono), signed 16 bit PCM little endian. Other types of media are NOT supported, such as : mp3, wav, etc... or need to be converted to uncompressed raw data. If the result is empty, your request data must be in wrong format in most case. Encoded base64 string of byte[] that generated from raw data less than 500KB (3-5 seconds sample are good enough for detection) will be sent via body as plain text

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: User's timezone

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The language code

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: This parameter is used to indicate that you are detecting the same song while making different calls in case the previous portion of sound cannot be recognized successfully. You simply use the same unix timestamp (milliseconds) which is the starting time of first sound portion of detecting progress. This parameter must be come along with \"samplems\" parameter. Ex : 1591884466431

constraints.inter-dependency: timestamp, samplems: timestamp must be provided along with samplems.

parameters.name: samplems
parameters.description: The samplems in milliseconds including the total duration of previous sound portions if any. Otherwise just provide the samplems of the current sound portion. Ex : First portion is 5040, second portion is 9040, etc...

constraints.inter-dependency: timestamp, samplems: samplems must be provided along with timestamp.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to indicate that you are detecting the same song while making different calls in case the previous portion of sound cannot be recognized successfully. You simply use the same id string while detecting the same song. This parameter must be come along with \"samplems\" parameter.
The format is xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx, Ex : 21abe4d2-0fe9-4be4-8492-0ecf26960f7e.

constraints.inter-dependency: identifier, samplems: identifier must be provided along with samplems.

api_methods.name: songs/detect
api_methods.description:
You may check the tutorial at https://rapidapi.com/apidojo/api/shazam/tutorials.
Detect songs from raw sound data. The raw sound data must be 44100Hz, 1 channel (Mono), signed 16 bit PCM little endian. Other types of media are NOT supported, such as : mp3, wav, etc... or need to be converted to uncompressed raw data. If the result is empty, your request data must be in wrong format in most case. Encoded base64 string of byte[] that generated from raw data less than 500KB (3-5 seconds sample are good enough for detection) will be sent via body as plain text

api_methods.name: songs/v2/detect
api_methods.description:
You may check the tutorial at https://rapidapi.com/apidojo/api/shazam/tutorials.
Detect songs from raw sound data. The raw sound data must be 44100Hz, 1 channel (Mono), signed 16 bit PCM little endian. Other types of media are NOT supported, such as : mp3, wav, etc... or need to be converted to uncompressed raw data. If the result is empty, your request data must be in wrong format in most case. Encoded base64 string of byte[] that generated from raw data less than 500KB (3-5 seconds sample are good enough for detection) will be sent via body as plain text

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: User's timezone

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The language code

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: This parameter is used to indicate that you are detecting the same song while making different calls in case the previous portion of sound cannot be recognized successfully. You simply use the same unix timestamp (milliseconds) which is the starting time of first sound portion of detecting progress. This parameter must be come along with \"samplems\" parameter. Ex : 1591884466431

constraints.inter-dependency: timestamp, samplems: timestamp must be provided along with samplems.

parameters.name: samplems
parameters.description: The samplems in milliseconds including the total duration of previous sound portions if any. Otherwise just provide the samplems of the current sound portion. Ex : First portion is 5040, second portion is 9040, etc...

constraints.inter-dependency: timestamp, samplems: samplems must be provided along with timestamp.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to indicate that you are detecting the same song while making different calls in case the previous portion of sound cannot be recognized successfully. You simply use the same id string while detecting the same song. This parameter must be come along with \"samplems\" parameter.
The format is xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx, Ex : 21abe4d2-0fe9-4be4-8492-0ecf26960f7e.

constraints.inter-dependency: identifier, samplems: identifier must be provided along with samplems.
